      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paint in class java.awt.Window
        Parameters:
        g - - The Systems Graphics object Override the frames Paint method, draw the backBuffer and sync with the system The purpose of this is to solve any strange rendering glitches, doing it this way allows for an image to be designed in the background and then brought forward all at once.

        public void loadData(java.lang.String fileName)
        Parameters:
        fileName - - A string filename The file given is the loaded as the current game state This method never needs to be touched as the only thing that is serialized is the 'data.java' class To access the loaded data, use 'data' the variable

      • setKeyChar

        public void setKeyChar(char keyChar)
        Set the current key being pressed to the currentChar variable The purpose of this if for typeing on screen. Once the keycode's char is passed in, that currentChar variable can be accessed at that time for typing, instead of accessing hundreds of keycodes and chars.
        Parameters:
        keyChar - - A char of what is being pressed down

      • updateSprites

        protected void updateSprites()

      • updateData

        protected void updateData(Map currentMap,
                          Map currentOverlay,
                          int playerX,
                          int playerY)
        Update the data object with all of the currently needed variables. This can be updated in the future after the 'Data.java' class has been correctly configured to allow for more parameters. The purpose of this is for storing data in a file for reloading an old file with that info. This method is called in your game for saving
        Parameters:
        currentMap - - A Map
        currentOverlay - - A Map
        playerX - - An Int
        playerY - - An Int

      • spriteCollision

        protected void spriteCollision()
        Detect when a sprite intersects a sprite and call a handling method currently only rectangles are used for detection. spr1 - The first sprite (Most of the time the player) spr2 - The second sprite (Most of the time a random npc or enemy) hitDir - The bound which is being intersected on spr1 hitDir2 - The bound which is being intersected on spr2

      • tileCollision

        protected void tileCollision()
        Same as the above spriteCollision() method but instead the collision is between a sprite and a Tile. Also, currently only with rectangles. The method gets a sprite and then gets each tile, if either objects intersects any bounds made for either object the method calls a handling method for dealing with very specific properties that are relative to each game

      • drawSprites

        protected void drawSprites()
